timeline.message:
Speed up RepositoryData Serialization

Make serializing `RepositoryData` a little faster and split up/document the code for it a little
as well given how massive this method has gotten at this point.

timeline.bodyText: No need for methods that mostly parse the same string here (like parsing the snapshot list in repository data) to over and over do the same regex magic in most cases.
timeline.author: original-brownbear

timeline.bodyText: No need to re-create the same string over and over for the same version constants (obviously in some cases this is wasted memory when we work with version constants that aren't cached but that's rare and the overhead is trivial anyway).
timeline.author: original-brownbear

timeline.bodyText: No need to instantiate a whole new map here in a loop for each snapshot when we can just extract the index id in a loop as we go.
timeline.author: original-brownbear

timeline.bodyText: Fill this up during parsing instead of doing another loop at the end of this method over all the indices
timeline.author: original-brownbear

timeline.bodyText: We only ever fill indexMetaIdentifiers once so we can just outright use the map from the parser.
timeline.author: original-brownbear

timeline.bodyText: All logic beyond this point hasn't really changed much except for moving to switch and using separate+ documented methods for parsing the lower levels.
timeline.author: original-brownbear

timeline.bodyText: Again saving a map relative to the old implementation by not using putAll once on a single map and instead just using the map from the parser
timeline.author: original-brownbear

timeline.bodyText: I'm not sure we can guarantee that the collection returned by this method is truly unmodifiable if we remove this?
timeline.author: tlrx

replies.bodyText: I think this is fine because if you look at the constructor of RepositoryData we always make sure that snapshotIds is unmodifiable which entails that it's value collection is as well :)
replies.author: original-brownbear

replies.bodyText: Right - I did not look at all the ctors, thanks
replies.author: tlrx

timeline.author: tlrx

replies.bodyText: I know, I actually wanted to use it here in all these spots but then I realized that it's pretty inefficient in it's current form. I fixed it to behave better in #62691 and would rather wait for that PR to go in before making that change to not make this method even larger (in terms of what it compiles to).
replies.author: original-brownbear

timeline.author: tlrx

replies.bodyText: Same comment here as above 100% on board with it, but let's wait for #62691 ?
replies.author: original-brownbear

timeline.author: tlrx

timeline.bodyText: Can we assert the state we are in after calling the parsing methods?
timeline.author: tlrx

replies.bodyText:
It's tricky IMO. We can't really assert this I think (because corrupted RepositoryData would trip the assertion) so it's not really correct to assert.
My thinking was that https://github.com/elastic/elasticsearch/pull/62684/files#diff-98674f75d80495aed41485d9103543e0R712 eventually ensures that the parser parsed the snapshots field first and figured that's enough and we don't need another runtime check for it?
replies.author: original-brownbear

replies.bodyText: OK, let's keep it that way then.
replies.author: tlrx
